subject: Re: [junit] How to extend our own testcase
msgSnippet: ... With respect, TestSetup has nothing to do with sharing test fixtures between test case classes. TestSetup is only for executing setUp() and tearDown() once
messageBody:
Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:

> <citation>
> However, it looks like you want to reuse set-up procedures between test
> suites. If this is true, extract these methods into a third class
> which you can use from your two test classes' setUp() methods.
> </citation>
>
> junit.extensions.TestSetup class (see javadoc in it)

With respect, TestSetup has nothing to do with sharing test fixtures
between test case classes. TestSetup is only for executing setUp() and
tearDown() once per test suite, rather than once per test.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
